sentence.Network_en: That foolish deed of his will remain a blot on his escutcheon.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的那种愚蠢行为将永远是他名誉上的污点.

sentence.Network_en: A wide vertical band in the center of an escutcheon.
sentence.Network_cn: 古代的士兵用饰有花纹的盾作战.

sentence.Network_en: Red Hand - Usual mark for a baronet if borne on a small escutcheon.
sentence.Network_cn: 红色的手 - 通常来说,如果这种符号安加在一面小型纹章盾上,那么它是准男爵的标记.

jx.jx_en_mean: a stain on one's reputation or character
a small shield within a coat of arms, bearing another coat or device to which the bearer has a claim, especially one to which a man's wife is heiress
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指女继承人丈夫佩戴的）盾形徽章中央的小盾片
污辱：对某人名誉有所不尊重

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from Anglo-Norman French escuchon, based on Latin scutum 'shield'

means.word_mean: 1. a flat protective covering (on a door or wall etc) to prevent soiling by dirty fingers
2. (nautical) a plate on a ship's stern on which the name is inscribed
3. a shield; especially one displaying a coat of arms

auth_sentence.content: Here was I, with guttersnipe rashness, chalking some rudeness upon Sir Barry Jackson's fine escutcheon.
